726658f-a.title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard
726658f-a.text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): Viewing southeastward across the
grounds of the World's Fair of 1939-40, seen from Roosevelt
Avenue and Willets Point Boulevard. Clearly visible is the Trylon--
the Fairs theme-- and some of the exhibition buildings under con-
straction.
View 2 shows the same area, in the Fair's second year of operation.
P.L. Sperr  View 1: May 30, 1938
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: June 23, 1940
726658f-a.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY

727941f-b.title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard
727941f-b.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, south side at Willets Point Boulevard, from
underneath the B. M. T. and I. R. T. subway ''El,'' showing this area
before it was improved to serve the millions of visitors who came
to the 1939-40 New York Worldta Fair.
September 30, 1935
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIO1S
727941f-b.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY

727942f-b.title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard
727942f-b.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, north side, at W1lets Point Boulevard,
viewing east and showing the Willets Potnt Boulevard station of
the I. R. T. and 8. M. T. subway systems. The area in the fore-
ground was later improved as an auto parking space for visitors
to the New York World'e Fair of 1939-4O.
October 18, 1936
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

728198f-c.title: Queens: Willets Point Boulev - Roosevelt Avenue

727943f-a.title: Queens: Roosevelt Avenue - Willets Point Boulevard
727943f-a.text:
Roosevelt Avenue, south side, east from near 7illets Point
Boulevard, showing the I. R. T. and B. M. T. subway ''El'' on the
former, running into Flushing across the Flushing River. This
area was later improved to accommodate automobile visitors to
the New York World e Fair 1939-40.
View 2 shows a more distant view of the ''El'' and the Flushing
River bridge, seen from the Long Island Railroad tracks; view 3
shows a gas station near the Boulevard.
View 1: October 18, 1936
Views 2,3: Nay 30, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
727943f-a.folder: Roosevelt Avenue & Willets Point Boulevard, Queens, NY
